subject: RE: [junit] debuggers
msgSnippet: ... JUnit make debuggers obsolete?  Are you implicitly referring to one of those aged development practices which recommend walking through your code in a
messageBody:
> From: steven.hale@... [mailto:steven.hale@...]
>
> Does junit make debuggers obsolete? Are there situations where junit in
> partnership with logging isn't sufficient?

JUnit make debuggers obsolete? Are you implicitly referring to one of those
aged development practices which recommend walking through your code in a
debugger as a test/quality assurance practice?

I would say any form of unit test is a better use of time than that
practice, regardless of JUnit.

If you're talking about a situation where you're debugging some
bowels-deep-in-the-JVM problem, then I don't see how JUnit has anything to
do with it. I mean, a debugger is a completely different tool. You can't
walk through stack frames, set break points, inspect threads, and
interactively step through executing Java byte code with JUnit or a logger.

Scott Stirling
